definitions: A condition in which the heart muscle is damaged or weakened due to a lack of blood flow, usually caused by a buildup of plaque in the coronary arteries.
A group of heart conditions caused by narrowed heart arteries, which reduces blood flow to the heart muscle.
examples: Risk factors for ischemic heart disease include high blood pressure and cholesterol.
Early diagnosis of ischemic heart disease can improve patient outcomes.
Lifestyle changes are often recommended to manage ischemic heart disease.
